intro: Mentzelia albicaulis var. gracilenta, commonly known as the slender whitehead, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb with slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Loasaceae family.
